chav1961.purelib.streams

Class JsonSaxHandlerFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • chav1961.purelib.streams.JsonSaxHandlerFactory

  • public class JsonSaxHandlerFactory
extends Object

    This Utility class allow you to build JsonSaxHandler implementation for automatic deserialization of any classes from JSON. This class is analyzing your class structure by reflection, and build appropriative handler to deserialize it, for example:

    final JsonSaxDeserializer<MyClass> h = JsonSaxHandlerFactory.buildDeserializer(MyClass.class,true);
    final JsonSaxParser p = new JsonSaxParser(h);
    p.parse(...);
    final MyClass deserialized = h.getInstance();

    The JsonSaxHandler implementation was built is a JsonSaxDeserializer interface implementation, which uses a list of deserialization rules to process data:

    • every JSON array reflects to appropriative array in the class you want to deserialise from JSON
    • every JSON object reflects to appropriative instance in the class you want to deserialise from JSON
    • every JSON name reflects to appropriative instance field with the same name in the class you want to deserialise from JSON

    Example of the rules:

    { --> public class MyClass
    "x" : 10, --> int x; // x = 10
    "y" : "test", --> String y; // y = "test"
    "z" : [10,20], --> int[] z; // z = new int[]{10,20}
    "t" : [30,40], --> double[] t; // t = new double[]{30,40}
    "a" : { --> public class MyInnerClass
    "x" : true, --> boolean x; // x = true;
    "y" : null --> Object y; // y = null;
    }, --> MyInnerClass a; // a = (see above)}
    } --> }

    Static and transient fields are not included in the deserialization process

    Pay attentiton, that you can call JsonSaxParser.parse(String) or any other similar method more than once, but all sequential calls will refill the same first deserialized instance was created in the first call. It allow you reduce memory requirements for the new deserialized instances. To avoid this functionality, always call JsonSaxDeserializer.use(null) before next parsing. You can also use this call to fill the predefined class instance with the deserialized data. Also pay attention, that on building JsonSaxHandler class with the publicOnly flag, it makes by reflection, but it's runtime not uses reflection, but on-the-fly built class to create new instances and set it's fields. It radically increases parsing speed, but strongly check visibility of the classes and methods. To avoid problems with the visibility, use only public classes in this case.

    This class is thread-safe

    Since:
    0.0.1
    Author:
    Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961
    See Also:
    RFC 7159, JsonSaxHandler, JsonSaxDeserializer, JUnit tests

      static <T> JsonSaxDeserializer<T> buildDeserializer(Class<T> clazz, boolean publicOnly)

    • Method Detail

      • buildDeserializer

        public static <T> JsonSaxDeserializer<T> buildDeserializer(Class<T> clazz,
                                                           boolean publicOnly)
                                                    throws NullPointerException,
                                                           ContentException

        Build JsonSaxHandler for automatic deserialization from JSON to the given class instance

        Type Parameters:
        T - class returned
        Parameters:
        clazz - class, which instance you want to deserialize json to
        publicOnly - use only public classes and fields in the class for deserialization purposes. It's strongly recommended to turn on this option, because it radically increases parsing performance
        Returns:
        JsonSaxDeserializer implementation to use in the constructor of the JsonSaxParser.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - when class descriptor is null
        ContentException - when any errors were detected
